Package onbon.y2

Y2 core library.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Workspace
    Y2 workspace.
    Y2UploadListener
    The upload listener will receive the events when a file or a binary data has been uploaded to the Y2.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Y2BulletinManager
    The manager provides functions to control bulletins areas.
    Y2Controller
    The controller provides abstract functions to control full-color board of the Y2 series.
    Y2DiagnosisTool
    The diagnosis tool executes Linux based command on the Y2.
    Y2DynamicManager
    The manager provides functions to control dynamic areas.
    Y2Env
    The class initializes the runtime environment of the library.
    Y2NetworkTool
    The network tool.
    Y2Properties
    The properties.
    Y2ResourceManager
    The resource manager provides functions to upload materials such as images, fonts, etc. to the Y2.
    Y2Screen
    The program provides full features to control full-color board of the Y2 series.
    Y2UploadManager
    This implementation of resource manager provides all functions to upload data to the real Y2.
    Y2UploadSimulator
    This implementation of resource manager simulates all functions.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    Y2Exception
    The exception.

Package onbon.y2 Description

Y2 core library.

This library provides operations to control full-color board of Y2 series.

Simple example: 
 // initial runtime environment, just once
 Y2Env.initial();

 // create a Y2 screen instance
 Y2Screen y2s = new Y2Screen(""http://192.168.9.140");

 // login
 y2s.login("guest", "guest");

 // turn on the screen
 y2.turnOn();

 // create a marquee area
 MarqueeArea area = new MarqueeArea(0, 0, 128, 36);
 area.addContent("Hello ONBON").bgColor(Color.darkGray);
 area.addContent("This is Y2 library").fgColor(Color.yellow);

 // create a program
 ProgramPlayFile playFile1 = new ProgramPlayFile(1);
 playFile1.setPriority(1);
 playFile1.getAreas().add(area);

 // write a program to Y2 and create a new play list
 String id = y2s.writePlayList(playFile1);

 // play
 y2s.play(id);

 // logout
 y2.logout();
See Also:
Y2 screen main program
